qas.question: Who was the most excellent Order of the British Empire?

answers.text: order of chivalry of British constitutional monarchy

qas.question: Who rewarded contributions to the arts and sciences?

answers.text: "order of chivalry of British constitutional monarchy

qas.question: When was the order of chivalry of British constitutional monarchy established?
Who established the chivalry of british constiutional monarchy?

answers.text: knight if male, or dame if female

context: The Most Excellent Order of the British Empire is the <a1_0>"<a0_0>order of chivalry of British constitutional monarchy<a1_0/><a0_0/>", rewarding contributions to the arts and sciences, work with charitable and welfare organisations and public service outside the Civil Service. It was established on <a2_0>4 June 1917<a2_0/> by <a3_0>King George V<a3_0/>, and comprises five classes, in civil and military divisions, the most senior two of which make the recipient either a <a4_0>knight if male, or dame if female<a4_0/>. There is also the related British Empire Medal, whose recipients are affiliated with, but not members of, the order.
